## World-Leading Experts in NEMD for Fluids and Interfaces

Our speakers bring decades of combined expertise in molecular dynamics, computational fluid dynamics, and interfacial phenomena.

::: {.speaker-grid}

::: {.speaker-card}

::: {.speaker-info}
### Jesper Schmidt Hansen
[Professor, Roskilde University, Denmark]{.affiliation}

Expert in computational fluid dynamics and molecular dynamics simulations. His research focuses on nonequilibrium processes, viscoelastic fluids, and the breakdown of classical hydrodynamics at the nanoscale.

[View profile →](https://forskning.ruc.dk/en/persons/jschmidt/)
:::
:::

::: {.speaker-card}

::: {.speaker-info}
### Samy Merabia
[Senior Research Director, CNRS Lyon, France]{.affiliation}

Specialist in nanoscale transport using molecular dynamics simulations. His work spans nanofluidics, slip at solid-liquid interfaces, wetting phenomena, and interfacial thermal conductance.

[View profile →](https://smerabia8.wixsite.com/monsite)
:::
:::

::: {.speaker-card}

::: {.speaker-info}
### Peter Daivis
[Professor, RMIT University, Australia]{.affiliation}

Specialist in polymer and colloid physics, computer simulation using equilibrium and non-equilibrium molecular dynamics, and molecular rheology of complex fluids.

[View profile →](https://www.rmit.edu.au/profiles/d/peter-daivis)
:::
:::

::: {.speaker-card}

::: {.speaker-info}
### Xinyan Wang
[Professor, Brunel University London, UK]{.affiliation}

UKRI Future Leaders Fellow applying molecular dynamics to energy and propulsion systems. His work bridges fundamental MD research and industrial applications in fuels and thermal-fluid systems

[View profile →](https://www.brunel.ac.uk/people/xinyan-wang)
:::
:::

::: {.speaker-card}

::: {.speaker-info}
### Donatas Surblys
[Associate Professor, Tohoku University, Japan]{.affiliation}

Expert in molecular dynamics simulations of interfaces, with a focus on heat fluxes, interfacial thermal transport, and wetting phenomena at solid-liquid boundaries.

[View profile →](https://www.ifs.tohoku.ac.jp/mht/jp/members/donatas.html)
:::
:::

::: {.speaker-card}

::: {.speaker-info}
### Nicodemo Di Pasquale
[Associate Professor, University of Bologna, Italy]{.affiliation}

Expert in multiscale modelling and the coupling of continuum and discrete methods, with particular emphasis on molecular simulations of solid-liquid interfaces. Specialized in surface interactions, thermodynamics, and adsorption phenomena.

[View profile →](https://www.unibo.it/sitoweb/nicodemo.dipasquale/en)
:::
:::

::: {.speaker-card}

::: {.speaker-info}
### Duncan Dockar
[Royal Academy of Engineering Research Fellow, The University of Edinburgh, UK]{.affiliation}

Expert in nanobubbles for water treatment, molecular dynamics, and nanoscale multiphase fluid simulation. His research focuses on cavitation dynamics and surface nanobubble behaviour.

[View profile →](https://multiscaleflowx.github.io/team/dockar-duncan/)
:::
:::

::: {.speaker-card}

::: {.speaker-info}
### Edward Smith
[Senior Lecturer in Fluid Dynamics, Brunel University London, UK]{.affiliation}

Specialist in multi-scale simulation methods combining particle and continuum approaches. His work includes coupled atomistic-continuum simulations, and the application of machine learning potentials to fluid dynamics problems.

[View profile →](https://www.brunel.ac.uk/people/edward-smith)
:::
:::

::: {.speaker-card}

::: {.speaker-info}
### Dmitry Nerukh
[Senior Lecturer, Aston University, UK]{.affiliation}

Expert in hybrid hydrodynamics/molecular dynamics multiscale modelling. His research includes atomistic simulations of viral systems and protein folding dynamics.

[View profile →](https://research.aston.ac.uk/en/persons/dmitry-nerukh)
:::
:::
